item.title: Tesco Names New Chairman
item.description: Tesco said Gerry Murphy has been appointed chairman and will join the board on September 1, replacing Byron Grote who will take up his previous role as senior independent director.

item.title: Dollar's Outlook Looks Increasingly Data-Dependent
item.description: The dollar has been lifted recently by “a series of good macro indicators” and suggestions from Powell that interest rates could rise further, Natixis said, expecting EUR/USD to stay in a range between 1.08 and 1.10 for now.

item.title: Metals Inch Higher As Supply Woes Provide Support
item.description: Base metals edged higher, as worries over supply provided some support to prices, while gold dipped with expectations of rate hikes providing pressure in the near term, ANZ said.

item.title: Oil Slips on Weak Demand Fears
item.description: Crude prices moved lower with ING saying the market still has the same concern as the last six months, an uncertain demand outlook and pointed to speculators cutting their net long positions in oil futures..

item.title: Eurozone Sovereign Spreads Cope With Idea of Faster Quantitative Tightening
item.description: Eurozone sovereign spreads have taken talk of faster ECB quantitative tightening in their stride, which is one more reason why it might happen, ING said.

item.title: Nikkei Rises 1.7% to 33-Year High, Led by Machinery Stocks
item.description: The Nikkei Stock Average rose 1.7% to close at 33753.33, the highest level since March 1990, after data showed that business sentiment among Japanese large manufacturers improved and as U.S. consumer inflation eased.

item.title: What It Takes to Convert a Multi-Million Dollar Office Into Housing
item.description: With housing in short supply, developers are converting more empty offices into apartments. But not all buildings are candidates for reuse, even as more than one billion square feet of office space sits vacant across the country.

item.title: Joe Biden's $400 Billion Man
item.description: Jigar Shah, who runs the Energy Department’s loan program, is trying to hand out a lot of money for green-technology projects, while navigating an unforgiving political environment.

item.title: Labor Market Headfake?
item.description: The high-profile payroll survey could be overestimating job growth because of quirks in how the data are calculated.

item.title: He Spent $140 Billion on AI With Little to Show. Now He Is Trying Again.
item.description: Billionaire Masayoshi Son said he would make SoftBank “the investment company for the AI revolution” but he missed out on the most recent frenzy.

item.title: Borrowers are facing new complications in the wake of the Supreme Court's decision to strike down Biden's mass student-debt cancellation plan.
item.description: Borrowers are facing new complications in the wake of the Supreme Court’s decision to strike down Biden’s mass student-debt cancellation plan.

item.title: Europe launched the first space telescope designed to study the mysterious dark universe, and how that part of the cosmos may one day determine its fate.
item.description: Europe launched the first space telescope designed to study the mysterious dark universe, and how that part of the cosmos may one day determine its fate.

item.title: At least two people were killed in a shooting at a Baltimore block party that left an additional 28 people injured, police said.
item.description: At least two people were killed in a shooting at a Baltimore block party that left an additional 28 people injured, police said.

item.title: Investors who last year embraced dividend-paying stocks now see greater promise in growth-focused tech stocks that don't typically pay dividends.
item.description: Investors who last year embraced dividend-paying stocks now see greater promise in growth-focused tech stocks that don’t typically pay dividends.

item.title: Tesla global deliveries surged 83% in the second quarter, helped by dramatic price cuts and hefty discounts as the electric-car maker chases growth in a competitive marketplace.
item.description: Tesla global deliveries surged 83% in the second quarter, helped by dramatic price cuts and hefty discounts as the electric-car maker chases growth in a competitive marketplace.

item.title: The boom in demand for chips powering the rise of artificial intelligence has given new life to cryptocurrency miners.
item.description: The boom in demand for chips powering the rise of artificial intelligence has given new life to cryptocurrency miners.

item.title: United Airlines plans to make changes to avoid a repeat of the disruption that snarled travel ahead of the Fourth of July holiday, chief Kirby told employees.
item.description: United Airlines plans to make changes to avoid a repeat of the disruption that snarled travel ahead of the Fourth of July holiday, chief Kirby told employees.

item.title: Twitter began limiting how many posts users can read on its platform, a move that came as owner Elon Musk says he is fighting companies trying to use its data for developing AI programs.
item.description: Twitter began limiting how many posts users can read on its platform, a move that came as owner Elon Musk says he is fighting companies trying to use its data for developing AI programs.

item.title: In the wake of a mutiny that almost reached Moscow, Russia's Putin is facing a new test: managing the takeover of Wagner Group, one of the most complex liquidations in history.
item.description: In the wake of a mutiny that almost reached Moscow, Russia’s Putin is facing a new test: managing the takeover of Wagner Group, one of the most complex liquidations in history.

item.title: Saudi Arabia is cutting back on crude output as part of a high-stakes gamble to crimp worldwide supply, but a key market indicator suggests that traders believe supplies won't shrink for months.
item.description: Saudi Arabia is cutting back on crude output as part of a high-stakes gamble to crimp worldwide supply, but a key market indicator suggests that traders believe supplies won’t shrink for months.
